climbs.name: Pass the Basalt
climbs.fa: Jay Foley, Russ Husted, Matt Bogar

content.description:
Start in crack behind free standing block 

  Once out of the dihedral, make a tricky and technical move to gain the roof and pull the roof. The crux protects well. Runout on easy climbing to the anchors
content.location: Behind the lard block to the left of the finger crack that leads to a bolted bulge.

content.description:
look for a splitter hand crack hidden in a left facing corner up in an alcove. Climb the crack to a tricky steep exit around small corner (crux, micro cams in seem out right helpful) Continue up pocketed face and steming make another tricky move over a bulge then straight up easy pockets to top 

  A fairly technical and tricky climb. However it does protect well
content.location: To the left of the finger crack that leads to a roof in front of a tree

content.description: Although this cliff is harder to locate it's possibly the  best option for trad climbing and shade in the Amole Area.Good rock down low with some short splitter sections, but still a bit vegitated in pocketed face above.
